result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abdul Hakim Mohamad Sharif

records.addlTxt: No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Abdul Hakim Mohamad Sharif in court.  Attorney Dean Sopsic appears as a friend of the court. Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as Rohingya interpreter: Shauah Ali. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 13. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Abdul Hakim Mohamad Sharif in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court allowing time for Rohingya interprter to appear in person. Case adjourned back to Out of Custody Court, Safety Building Room 221.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/6/22 @ 1p
